Allocation_Pool_HierarchyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Allocation_Pool_HierarchyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Allocation_Pool_HierarchyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Allocation_Pool_Hierarchy_Request_Refere.description: Contains references to Allocation Pool Hierarchies in the request and or response.

description: Contains the reference that identifies the Allocation Pool Hierarchy to retrieve.
Contains additional criteria for identifying specific Allocation Pool Hierarchy instances.

Response_Filter.description: Indicates the date when application data, such as benefits and compensation, become effective (Also referred to as the Effective Moment). If you don't specify a date, this date defaults to today.{+4}
The date and time the data was entered into the system. (This field is also referred to as the Entry Moment). If the date isn't specified, the default date is the current date and time.

The numbered page of data Workday returns in the response. The default page is the first page(Page = 1). For responses that contain more than one page of data, use this parameter to retrieve the additional pages of data. For example, set Page = 2 to retrieve the second page of data.Note: If you set the page parameter, you must also specify the "As_Of_Entry_Date" to ensure that the result set remains the same between your requests.
Sets the number of objects to return within each response page. Set a value between 1 and 999. The default value is 100.

description: Contains parameters for filtering the data returned in the response. You can filter response data by dates and page attributes.

Allocation_Pool_Hierarchy_Response_Group.description: A flag when set to true, includes the Allocation Pool Hierarchy in the response.

description: Wrapper element containing a list of elements representing the amount of data that should be included in the Allocation Pool Hierarchy response. If this element is not included then Workday includes ALL Response Groups in the response.
